include/ulib/replace/getopt.h

00001 /* getopt.h */
00002 
00003 #ifndef _GETOPT_H
00004 #define _GETOPT_H 1
00005 
00006 #ifdef __cplusplus
00007 extern "C" {
00008 #endif
00009 
00010 /* For communication from `getopt' to the caller. When `getopt' finds an option that takes an argument, the argument value is returned here.
00011  * Also, when `ordering' is RETURN_IN_ORDER, each non-option ARGV-element is returned here.
00012  */
00013 
00014 extern U_EXPORT char* optarg;
00015 
00016 /* Index in ARGV of the next element to be scanned.  This is used for communication to and from the caller and for communication
00017  * between successive calls to `getopt'. On entry to `getopt', zero means this is the first call; initialize. When `getopt' returns
00018  * -1, this is the index of the first of the non-option elements that the caller should itself scan. Otherwise, `optind' communicates
00019  * from one call to the next how much of ARGV has been scanned so far.
00020  */
00021 
00022 extern U_EXPORT int optind;
00023 extern U_EXPORT int opterr; /* Callers store zero here to inhibit the error message `getopt' prints for unrecognized options */
00024 extern U_EXPORT int optopt; /* Set to an option character which was unrecognized */
00025 
00026 /* Describe the long-named options requested by the application. The LONG_OPTIONS argument to getopt_long or getopt_long_only is a vector
00027  * of `struct option' terminated by an element containing a name which is zero. The field `has_arg' is:
00028  *
00029  * no_argument                  (or 0) if the option does not take an argument,
00030  * required_argument (or 1) if the option requires an argument,
00031  * optional_argument (or 2) if the option takes an optional argument.
00032  *
00033  * If the field `flag' is not NULL, it points to a variable that is set to the value given in the field `val' when the option is found, but
00034  * left unchanged if the option is not found. To have a long-named option do something other than set an `int' to a compiled-in constant,
00035  * such as set a value from `optarg', set the option's `flag' field to zero and its `val' field to a nonzero value (the equivalent single-letter
00036  * option character, if there is one). For long options that have a zero `flag' field, `getopt' returns the contents of the `val' field
00037  */
00038 
00039 struct option {
00040         const char *name;
00041         int has_arg; /* has_arg can't be an enum because some compilers complain about type mismatches in all the code that assumes it is an int */
00042         int* flag;
00043         int val;
00044 };
00045 
00046 /* Names for the values of the `has_arg' field of `struct option'
00047 # define no_argument                    0
00048 # define required_argument 1
00049 # define optional_argument 2
00050 */
00051 
00052 /* Get definitions and prototypes for functions to process the arguments in ARGV (ARGC of them, minus the program name) for options given in OPTS.
00053  * Return the option character from OPTS just read.  Return -1 when there are no more options.  For unrecognized options, or options missing
00054  * arguments, `optopt' is set to the option letter, and '?' is returned. The OPTS string is a list of characters which are recognized option
00055  * letters, optionally followed by colons, specifying that that letter takes an argument, to be placed in `optarg'. If a letter in OPTS is
00056  * followed by two colons, its argument is optional.  This behavior is specific to the GNU `getopt'. The argument `--' causes premature termination
00057  * of argument scanning, explicitly telling `getopt' that there are no more options. If OPTS begins with `--', then non-option arguments are treated
00058  * as arguments to the option '\0'. This behavior is specific to the GNU `getopt'
00059  */
00060 
00061 extern U_EXPORT int u_getopt_long(int argc, char* const* argv, const char* shortopts, const struct option* longopts, int* longind);
00062 
00063 /* I don't use this...
00064  * extern int u_getopt(int argc, char* const* argv, const char* optstring);
00065  * extern int u_getopt_long_only(int argc, char* const* argv, const char* shortopts, const struct option* longopts, int* longind);
00066  */
00067 
00068 #ifdef __cplusplus
00069 }
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 #endif
